intro: Campanula punctata, commonly known as the spotted bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with distinctive white or yellow spots. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campanula punctata is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate.
